Description: Ostracon (?), fragment of the upper-body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric is greyish in section, the interior is encrusted with a grey-brown resinous deposit, the exterior, the lower section of which is ribbed, is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of one line of red-painted cursive text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394889) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394889)
